DOCNAME: CASE OF TOCONO AND PROFESORII PROMETEISTI v. MOLDOVA
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Impartial tribunal;Independent tribunal);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE , immediately after the collapse of GPE , ORG , ORG and ORG took the initiative to create the first private high school in GPE ( “ the school ” ) . In view of the lack of legislation regulating private education , ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , in which they confirmed that ORG was the school 's sole founder and that the school was to be financed from the local budget , donations , fees and money invested by ORG .
CARDINAL . In DATE the school , called ORG , was opened .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government issued Decision no . CARDINAL amending the previous decision and naming as co - founders of the school CARDINAL other legal entities which had invested in it .
CARDINAL . DATE the school existed without State registration , owing to the lack of any legislation governing that area .
CARDINAL . In DATE , after the enactment of legislation concerning private education , the school was required to obtain State registration .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following a request by the school 's head teacher , ORG no . CARDINAL , repealing Decision no . CARDINAL . On DATE it was published in ORG and entered into force .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG and a group of teachers from the school , who had joined forces to create a foundation called “ FAC ” , registered new articles of association for the school in accordance with the new legislation . The new articles stated that there were CARDINAL founders - Tocono and Profesorii Prometeişti- and that the school would thenceforth be called S.R.L. Prometeu . DATE the newly created entity was issued with a ORG registration certificate .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following a request by the school 's former co - founders , ORG no . CARDINAL repealing Decision no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL of the former co - founders mentioned in Decision no . CARDINAL brought an action against ORG and against ORG , seeking to have the registration of the new entity ORG declared null and void on the ground that they should also have been included as co - founders of the school in accordance with decision No . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the action . It found , inter alia , that at the date of registration of the new school ( DATE ) , Decision no . CARDINAL had no longer been in force .
CARDINAL . The plaintiffs lodged an appeal with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE a panel of ORG , composed of judges PERSON , GPE and GPE , upheld the appeal , quashed the judgment of ORG and ruled in favour of the former co - founders . It observed , inter alia , that the request for registration of ORG had been lodged with ORG on DATE , when Decision no . CARDINAL of DATE had still been in force . It also decided to exclude ORG from the list of founders of the school .

CARDINAL . The applicants did not learn of the composition of the panel until DATE of the hearing . They alleged not to have known at the time of the hearing that , DATE , Judge PERSON 's son had been expelled from the school for misbehaviour , truancy and bad grades , an expulsion carried out by the head teacher of the school and by teachers who formed part of ORG . As a result of the incident the judge had allegedly threatened the school authorities with retaliation .
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of LAW as in force at the material time read as follows :
LAW for challenging a judge
A judge shall not be admitted to sit in a case or may be challenged in the following cases :
( CARDINAL ) if he or she participated in an earlier stage of the proceedings as a witness , expert , interpreter , representative , prosecutor or registrar ;
( CARDINAL ) if he or she is personally interested , directly or indirectly , in the outcome of the proceedings or if there are other reasons to doubt his or her impartiality ;
( CARDINAL ) if he or she , his or her spouse or his or her ascendants or descendants have any interest in the outcome of the proceedings ... ;
( CARDINAL ) if his spouse ... is a relative of CARDINAL of the parties to the proceedings ... ;
( CARDINAL ) if he or she is a guardian ... of CARDINAL of the parties to the proceedings .
Article CARDINAL The request to challenge a judge
If the circumstances indicated in LAW are present , the judge shall be obliged to withdraw from the case .
For the same reasons the parties to the proceedings may challenge [ a judge ] .

A challenge must be declared , and reasons given , before the examination of the merits of the case . A challenge may be declared later only if the party to the proceedings learned about the reasons for the challenge after the beginning of the proceedings . If the circumstances [ indicated above ] become known to the court after the examination of the case has begun , the court shall be obliged to inform the parties in order to decide on the matter of [ incompatibility ] . ”
